storyInfo: The Nativity is successfully completed. Countless eyes witness an arborbeast give birth to a fledgling with a halo. The Matriarch announces that Laterano will bestow its halo upon all. Federico and Arturia return to reality and find that all of Laterano is under the influence of a 'dream'.

attributes.content: Wait a moment, Senior Executor. So you never intended to bring Arturia back to Landen Monastery?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I never stated that I would.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Well, if you won't, I will!
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: There are certain things I must still ascertain with Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Now, now, Federico, it won't do to torment a poor nun like that.
Richele?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Did you have to run away so suddenly? All I did was joke around with you a little in front of that confessional.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: What was the joke?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Uh, okay... anyway, I know this fugitive's a tough one, so I brought reinforcements.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Giving up my chance to witness the Nativity in the process. Aren't you touched?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I never requested assistance from the Notarial Hall.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I know, I know. You hardly ever work with the other executors.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: You think I volunteered for this? Special orders, jointly issued by all seven tribunals of the Curia.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Pretty shocked when I got the orders... for a moment there, I thought Arturia had convinced you to commit treason.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I have no such intention, and she has no such power.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I have completed my assessment and determined that any risk to the Curia can be eliminated. You and your men may stand down now, Executor Richele.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Are you defying the special orders, Federico?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: You're have no authority to refuse.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: My orders were to oversee Federico's apprehension of Arturia before the Nativity, and to bring both of you in, should there be any suspicious behavior.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Not so fast, Senior Executor.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Were you talking to me, Seniora Arturia?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I've been sitting in that monastery ever since I got back. I think I would like to stretch my legs for a while longer still.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It's been more than a decade since I last saw night fall upon the Holy City... the view from this spot is remarkable.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So you're resisting arrest... Oh, I do so hate overtime.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Stay behind us, Sister Hildegard.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: You do the honors, Federico. You've been on this criminal's case for years. No one knows her tricks better than you.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Looks like the Lateran has long had its eye on you, Fede.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Raise your gun. It won't be the first time.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia stands at the edge of the roof. Federico has many questions, but he can see that her fingers are already touching the strings.
Behind her, Federico sees the Shrine of Nurtury, so tall he cannot see the top, and the infinite crowd meandering towards it.
Richele and his other colleagues stand behind him. Federico hears the sound of weapons being locked and loaded.
Tension runs high. It is as though he must prove something as executor.
There is no time to think. Federico raises his gun.
You have admitted to escaping confinement, Arturia. By the authority of the Lateran Notarial Hall, I am hereby reassessing your danger level and apprehension procedures.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You must fulfill your obligations as a Lateran citizen and work with us to resolve any threat to Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Without warning, the muzzle of Federico's gun flashes.
At the same time, music pours out of the cello, becoming one with the hymns emitting from the direction of the Shrine of Nurtury, drowning out the sounds on the roof.
Ugh—!
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Federico! What are you doing?!
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I shot at the building beside you. I did not strike any of you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But... that hurts... Mastigia! I think a rock hit my head... am I bleeding?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Do you know what you've done, Federico...?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Yes, you are bleeding.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I will submit a detailed report once the incident is resolved.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I will include a detailed explanation of the head injury you have suffered.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That was decisive, Senior Executor.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Now, how do you intend to handle all these unconscious people... what are you looking for?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Richele has an annual pass for the confessionals. They can deliver these people to a hospital.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Now, share your discoveries and work with me to resolve any dangers to Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's just a guess.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You chased me all the way here, then got your cohorts out of the way. You've evidently arrived at the same theory I have.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It's almost time, Fede.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Perhaps the city itself will soon tell us exactly what has happened to it.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I've never seen so many outsiders in Laterano.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: That's for sure.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: The last Summit of Nations didn't have enough guests to fill a single hotel.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Just about every cardinal in the Curia is here... it's so crowded. The air is even more awkward than the Basilica.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: We're far enough on the edge, Mostima. We're like the cleaners standing against the wall of a casino.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Whatever this Nativity is, it's probably Andoain bringing out a Sankta kid who just learned to talk, so the Matriarch standing there gets to ceremonially polish the kid's halo...
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: All symbolic puff. We could be home watching One-Armed Chainsaw Guy 2 instead.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Let's just think of it as watching Nurturer Andoain work.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Haven't you already said all that needs to be said to him?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: My heart's been feeling twitchy for some reason...
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Do you feel it, Mostima?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Fiammetta turns sideways. She has never seen such a serious expression on her friend's face.
I'm feeling nervous... no, anxious, fearful. It's excitement and expectation, and I don't know why...
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: I can't describe it. It's like my heartbeat isn't my own.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Is this empathy?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: You're a fallen Angel and I'm a Liberi. Neither of us has the power. No, it's not just us...
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Fiammetta scans the crowd, and is now certain that this heartbeat is not an illusion.
The emotions that she is feeling are written on every face in the crowd. Every heart present throbs to this beat, which does not belong to them.
...Look up.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Comfort bells.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Fiammetta follows her friend's gaze.
All the doors and windows were closed when the Nativity began. Not so much as a breeze can get in.

But the comfort bells are swaying in time, the ones hanging in the Hall of Enlightenment with them, and the ones in the corridors leading to the nurseries. Yet they do not produce the chimes that they should.
A sort of medium... like the musical devices that Leithanians use.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: If my guess is right, we're feeling the heartbeat of the mother who is giving birth.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: It's exactly the same!
attributes.name: Sankta

attributes.content: It's exactly the same as what I felt when I waited outside the delivery room when my wife gave birth!
attributes.name: Sankta

attributes.content: I could feel the unfathomable pain, but she would not give up. Her emotions tugged at mine, and we both spoke the name that we had already decided...
attributes.name: Sankta

attributes.content: 'Bailey, Bailey...'
attributes.name: Sankta

attributes.content: Lord above!
attributes.name: Liberi

attributes.content: The mother fainted? She's too weak. The pain of birthing is more than she can take... i-it's not good!
attributes.name: Liberi

attributes.content: My heart's about to leap out of my mouth.
attributes.name: Perro

attributes.content: She's not giving up...
attributes.name: Lupo

attributes.content: Lord, Holy City Most Pure, have mercy on us.
attributes.name: Liberi

attributes.content: Have mercy on us.
attributes.name: Lupo & Kuranta & Feline

attributes.content: Have mercy on us.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: So... this really is a form of... 'empathy'.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Comfort bells sway violently throughout the hall. The ever-shifting emotions in the irregular heartbeats tug at everyone's nerves.
No one knows who the mother is, what her name is, how old she is, where she came from... but everyone knows what she is experiencing. No one moves a single step.

The fragile newborn has not yet triumphed over death. The struggle to break through the shell of ignorance seems eternal. Inside the Shrine of Nurtury, thousands of people experience a childbirth together—
Such clear empathy should never have existed in Laterano.
After a long, long time...
The heartbeat begins to weaken, until all is silent.
Connect the sensor wire, and activate the timer.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: The last bomb... is ready!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Dammit, it's really hard not to march to this heartbeat!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: *pant*—*pant*—
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Fortunately, I've got the quickest brain in Penguin Logistics!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: I could play Super Music Tycoon with one hand and raygun bottle shooting with the other, and beat both the boss and Texas at the same time!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: All that practice wasn't for nothing!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Two minute countdown.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Blow up this corridor, and the path to the nursery will be cut off.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: I hope my sister's intel is good...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: The Shrine of Nurtury took a pregnant Sarkaz from a nomadic abbey, and got her to give birth to a Sarkaz at the Summit of Nations in this crazy ceremony...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: I don't know what they're trying to do, but if I can keep her from appearing in front of the crowd—
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Excuse me, you're in the way.
The mother is about to give birth. I want to get closer and pray for her.

attributes.name: Exusiai
attributes.content: Sorry, I'll...

attributes.name: Exusiai
attributes.content: Wait.
Pregnant... Sarkaz... aren't you the one?!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Yeah. What of it?
attributes.name: Extra

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Shouldn't you be giving birth—
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Lemuel, right?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: We've met before. Your sister brought you to our place.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Oh, er, Fiammetta's grandpa... salve...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: The others are searching for the bombs and neutralizing them, Reverend Patrizion.
attributes.name: Gun-Knight

attributes.content: Good work.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Stop this Sankta. She has more explosives on her.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Snipers are in position. We will shoot to kill if the suspect attempts to escape.
attributes.name: Shrine Patrol

attributes.content: Phew.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Reverend Patrizion...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You're late, Cardinal Lemuen.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Take the suspect back to the Seventh Tribunal.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: But if the Nativity isn't about this Sarkaz, then...?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: The heartbeat that resonated throughout the hall has quieted down.
A door opens to a corridor. Exusiai looks in the direction of the sound—
Carrying a small bundle, the Nurturer stands in the light shining through the door. His hands and robes are stained with blood, but the bundle is clean.
With head bowed, he walks slowly toward the Hall of Enlightenment, towards the waiting Matriarch. The crowd parts to let him through.
Thank you, Andoain.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: The Matriarch takes the newborn from the Nurturer. She cannot see, and thus does not realize that his brow is furrowed in sorrow.
The Matriarch gently opens the bundle, and reveals the newborn—
A fledgling beast.
He leans against the Matriarch's shoulder, mucous membrane still sticking to its infantile paws. The wet and creased fur shows no sign of relaxing.
His eyes are closed, his breathing barely audible.
As you can see, the first life that the Shrine of Nurtury has brought into this world is this fledgling arborbeast.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: His weight is nothing. His weight is everything.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: Before I came to Laterano, I found his mother in an abandoned nomadic abbey. She was so famished, her feathers fallen, that I did not at first recognize her as an arborbeast.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: A hunter's spear had impaled the mother's abdomen, but missed the fetus by inches.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: I do not know how his mother hid for so long, how she survived, and how she stayed awake through the pain and hunger.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: Until now.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: I thank this strong mother, our Sankta and Liberi brethren, and our honored guests from afar—
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: This child was born amidst our prayers. He is a miracle that you have made together.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: But why...?
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: Why do his eyes not open?
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: Matriarch. The newborn's breathing is growing weaker...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I tried everything I could think of. His mother gave her all.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Perhaps the mother's injuries were too grave, depriving the fetus of nutrition...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Andoain, we may all have forgotten one thing.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: Do you mean...?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: The childbirth was long and painful. But from beginning to end, all we felt through the comfort bells, through empathy, was a single heartbeat.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: This child was so weak that he could not even express his desire to live, the most primal, most instinctive cry of life.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Andoain bows his head and does not speak.
Is this what you thought the Nativity would be, Mostima?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Normally, we'd already be cutting the cake beside a crying baby...
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Damn, this is depressing.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Do they mean that after all that effort from the mother, the baby was stillborn?
attributes.name: Lupo

attributes.content: Che cazzo! How could this be?!
attributes.name: Lupo

attributes.content: Lord above!
attributes.name: Feline

attributes.content: Is there anything we can do? Like what we did just now, the thousands of us here...
attributes.name: Feline

attributes.content: What if I never felt Bailey's heartbeat after hours of waiting outside the delivery room...? What would my wife and I have done...?
attributes.name: Sankta

attributes.content: No, I can't bear to imagine it!
attributes.name: Sankta

attributes.content: Poor baby, if you can hear my voice...
attributes.name: Sankta

attributes.content: Somewhere in the crowd, someone begins sobbing.
Gradually, more and more people lose control of their emotions. Their cries join together and echo through the halls, for the poor mother and her stillborn child.
Then, another cry rings out.
It is not a sad sound. It is young and bright.

The fledgling arborbeast opens its eyes, and, as though sensing the emotions of the crowd, cries out for the first time in its life. It stretches its limbs, and the sheen miraculously returns to its fur.

The Matriarch embraces the newborn life tightly, crying tears of joy. One such tear drops from the empty eye sockets behind her veil, falling upon the fledgling's head, reflecting the light of the sun.
The fledgling does not stop crying. As though driven by the wailing, the light begins to break free of the void's shackles, becoming rich and full—
A halo.
The mark of the Sankta, the symbol of the Law, the embodiment of truth. It has illuminated this unfamiliar creature—
A shining, miraculous beacon.
The Lord has once again answered our prayer. He has blessed this child.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: This is a miracle not seen in a thousand years. Its appearance on the eve of calamity is a revelation from the Law.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: We are all witnesses. We are all participants.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: Henceforth, we are born equal and one, beginning with the Holy City, and ending with the Holy City.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: —As Sankta.
attributes.name: Matriarch

attributes.content: In the Matriarch's embrace, the newborn licks her arms. He has awakened.
Once again, the comfort bells sway. A new heartbeat, strong and regular, fills the Shrine of Nurtury.
Laterano granted a halo to an arborbeast fledgling?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Even the most incredible miracle in The Saints' Travels pales in comparison.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Is this a divine blessing, or a terrible calamity?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: My greater concern is whether it is true, whether it should be believed.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Since when did you start doubting everything you see?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: There are too many details, Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The unusual confessional.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The boundless wheat fields.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The crackdown on the manufacturing of firearms and explosives. The firearms workshops being shut down.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The sudden change in Landen Monastery's role.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The abrupt changes in the administration of the Curia. The colleagues who suddenly appeared to interfere with my investigation.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It was the appearance of Richele and his men, despite the fact that he should not have known my movements, that confirmed my suspicions. Otherwise, I would have continued my efforts to apprehend you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: All of these anomalies converge at this Shrine of Nurtury, which seems to have appeared out of nowhere, and the Nativity that so many have fixed their eyes on.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The missing mother you were investigating from the nomadic abbey was the pregnant arborbeast?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: By chance, my music crossed paths with the voice of her heart. I followed the trail here.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The singular item that brought me to my conclusion, of greater weight than any of the above, is how the Lateran people are seemingly oblivious to all of this.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Everything in life has been turned upside-down, but in this country, this city, life goes on, orderly as ever, as though things have always been so.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: When six million Laterans continue to live as they always have, it's hard for us to convince ourselves that we're the only sane ones.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Self-doubt is an invaluable experience for a hardhead like you, isn't it?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Are you certain now?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Mathematics, physics, geography, archaeology, astronomy... no theory or knowledge in science, theology, or philosophy can explain this.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: A city with a population of six million, sharing the same hallucination.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But the present circumstances clearly run contrary to the order of Laterano and the foundation of the Law.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I have no doubt.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What a coincidence. Neither do I—
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: The sound of comfort bells echoes in the sky above the city. The cello's music draws upon a crack, like a hand reaching into the city. The next instant, both sounds are brought to an abrupt halt.
The crowds that come and go in front of the square have never existed. Laterano has never been so quiet, even when the city is gazed upon from the highest roof of the Basilica.
Federico and Arturia are unsure if they blinked. A scene most incomprehensible plays out before their eyes—
The shrine continues to tower over the city, utterly out of place, but now dream-like colors begin to run across its surface.
Almost reaching the clouds, it spills its colors upon the pristine white buildings surrounding it.
Doors and windows open to the streets and alleys of Laterano, wherever the shrine's shadow touches, and creatures the likes of which have never been seen before emerge from them...
The scene is indescribable, but there is no doubt in Federico or Arturia that this is the real Laterano.
The next instant, the same word slips from their mouths.
